results.title: Pattern for instruction
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Jack Denove
results.brief_description: An account of the methods that should be adopted to instruct others in a new job or otherwise. The methods of a football coach are referred to by analogy.

results.title: Pattern for chemicals
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Denis Segaller
results.brief_description: An introduction to the use of refinery gases, as derived from the ‘cracking’ proccesses, as raw material for a new chemical industry. From the cracked gas molecules and others, the chemist and the chemical engineer have learned to fashion and construct in new ways the molecules of a great many useful substances.

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Women's Program of the AFC, Catherine South and Janet McLeod
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.

results.title: Patron: Piaget in new perspective
results.creator_credit: Parents' Magazine Films and Susan Sussman
results.brief_description: A personal view of child psychologist and educator, Jean Piaget, as seen by friends and colleagues. Piaget is also seen lecturing and in private moments.

results.title: Patrol and troop program planning
results.brief_description: While indicating the need for preparatory work on paper, this film emphasizes that the scout master must continually keep in mind the boy in the out-of-doors. Starting with the general aims, the film demonstrates the places of the Troop Committee, parents, patrol and the troop in a democratically planned programme. Shows the smooth co-ordination of these groups to produce a workable plan which is successfully carried out.

results.title: Patrol and troop meetings
results.brief_description: Designed for use in the training of Scoutmasters. Shows typical activities at a troop meeting from the arrival of the Service Patrol through to the last “Goodnight, fellas”. The film cautions on the need for flexibility in the conduct of meetings, emphasizing that there is no such thing as a standard meeting.

results.title: Patrol and troop camping
results.brief_description: Shows the successful results of planning and meetings whihc have ben hel prior to a camping excursion. The film follows a group pf scouts as they reap the dividends of intelligent preperation for camp and of long-term camping experiences.

results.title: Patrick [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian International Film Corporation, Antony Ginnane and Richard Franklin
results.brief_description: Patrick, having murdered his mother and her lover, has become a polyplegic, pre-oedipal, psychotic lump. He has telekinetic powers, fancies his nurse and is hostile to his doctor. This is an entertaining mix of black humour and suspense with a few shocks. Cast includes Susan Penhaligon, Robert Helpmann and Rod Mullinar.

results.title: Patrick
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon for children which tells the story of Patrick and of the magical things that happen when he plays his violin. Based on the book written and illustrated by Quentin Blake, and told without words. Sound montage by Gene Deitch. Animation by Milan Klikar and Bohumil Sejda. Colour and background paintings by Miluse Hluchanicova.
